map.string: Display a notification if a landmark is added to your inventory.

Force malformed prims to be treated as invalid. This setting derenders all malformed prims, even those that might not cause obvious issues. Setting to false will allow bad prims to render but can cause crashes. (Disabled on OpenSim)
Makes Comm->Friends and Comm->Groups open the v2 based windows.
Controls the height of folder items, for instance in inventory
Max length of group name to be printed in chat (-1 for full group name, 0 for disabled).
Flash IM tab when friend goes online or offline.
Amount to fade IM text into the background of the chat transcript floater (0.25-1.0, 0.25 for really light, 1 for fully visible).
If you make this too small you might not be able to read IMs that are shown in chat transcript.
Use the classic V1.x circular menu instead of the rectangular context menus when right clicking on land, avatars, objects or attachments.
If enabled, the labels in the pie menu slices are affected by the popup effect (they move into position).
If enabled, a shade around the outside of the pie menu will be drawn, adding a further visualization of sub menus.
Hide the chat bar from the bottom button bar and only show it as an overlay when needed.
Whether to fetch a grid list from the URL specified in GridListDownloadURL.
Fetch a grid list from this URL.
If true, shows dummy (preview) avatars in radar.
Show extended information in hovertips about objects (classic Phoenix style)
Modify the speed at which the avatar responds to turning movements. 0-100 percent of max rate. Default is 0.
Color Client tags by: 0=Off, 1=Single color per Viewer, 2=User defined color (one color per UUID), 3=New Tagsystem Color
Show client tags: 0=Client tags Off, 1=That are on the TPVD (needs FSUseLegacyClienttags), 2=That are on the client_tag.xml (needs FSUseLegacyClienttags), 3=That using the new system
Show legacy name (Firstname Lastname) in user tags instead of username
Color username distinctly from the rest of the tag
If true the camera will be reset to behind the avatar on teleporting
If true, IM will also be shown in the nearby chat transcript.
If true, instructions about leaving Mouseview are displayed.
If true, IM will also be logged in the nearby chat transcript if logging nearby chat and showing IMs in nearby chat is enabled.
If true, L$ balance changes will be shown in nearby chat instead of toasts.
If true, script dialogs will be shown opaque and ignore the floater opacity settings.
How many frames after an update should we wait before sorting
If true, group notices will be shown opaque and ignore the floater opacity settings.
Select the timezone to be used with Teleport History. ('utc' = default, 'slt' = Second Life Time, 'local' = the local timezone of the client)
Shows stream metadata (artist, title) notifications. (0 = Off, 1 = Notification Toast, 2 = Nearby Chat)
Announces stream metadata to a defined chat channel.
Chat channel where stream metadata is announced to.
Whether to color a friends mini map icon based on their friends groups
Whether to color a friends name tag based on their friends groups

Whether to color a friends chat based on their friends groups

Whether or not to add objects instead of wearing them
Whether or not to add clothes instead of wearing them
If TRUE, the viewer won't delete unpacked cache files when logging out (improves overall performance and fixes sound bugs)
UUID of sound asset that when detected, will request a full radar channel alert update
Toggles whether radar sends out chat alerts when it detects a new avatar
Toggles whether radar sends out chat alerts when it detects an avatar has left

Shows/Hides the chat type selector (Whisper, Say, Shout)
Holds the position where script llDialog floaters will show up. 1 = docked to chiclet, 2 = top left, 3 = top right, 4 = bottom left, 5 = bottom right
Internal, volatile control that defines if the dialog stack browser icon is visible.

Whether the next use of the Fly Override would be the first use

Display a chat message when avatar leaves draw distance

When TRUE, forbids to set the environment (time of day and Windlight settings) via RestrainedLove. Needs a restart of the viewer.
If a folder name begins with this string, its attach behavior will always be "replace", never "stack". Default is blank (disabled).
When TRUE, show "..." when someone speaks, while the avatar is prevented from hearing. When FALSE, don't show anything.
If a folder name begins with this string, its attach behavior will always be "stack", never "replace". Default is "+".

A URL pointing to a crash report handler; overrides cluster negotiation to locate crash handler.
